In the non-inverting amplifier the input resistance (the resistance looking into the input port) is infinite, because the operational amplifier does not take any current into its input terminals (in our model: this is only approximately true.)
However, the inverting amplifier has a finite input resistance.
In our circuit \(R_1 = $R_1\Omega\) and \(R_2 = $R_2\Omega\). Here we look at how the input resistance depends on the gain of the operational amplifier.
If \(A = $A_1\) what is the input resistance \(v_I/i_I\), in Ohms, of this amplifier?
If \(A = $A_2\) what is the input resistance \(v_I/i_I\), in Ohms, of this amplifier?
If \(A = $A_3\) what is the input resistance \(v_I/i_I\), in Ohms, of this amplifier?
Notice how the resistance approaches \(R_2 = $R_2\) as \(A \rightarrow \infty\).
